security_audit.summary: This skill provides GitHub issue triage functionality through helper scripts that interact with GitHub CLI. All code behavior matches the stated purpose of issue management. Risk factors include executable scripts and external commands, but these are standard tools (gh, jq) used for legitimate GitHub API operations. No credential theft, data exfiltration, or malicious patterns detected. Static findings of 'weak cryptographic algorithm' and 'C2 keywords' are false positives - scanner misidentified SHA256 hash strings and common English words in documentation as security threats.

content.value_statement: Managing GitHub issues can be overwhelming when duplicates accumulate and priorities are unclear. This skill automates issue triage by detecting duplicates, classifying bugs vs features, mapping relationships between issues, and generating triage reports to keep projects organized.
actual_capabilities: Classify issues by type (bug, feature, enhancement, documentation) and priority (critical, high, medium, low)
Detect duplicate issues using keyword and fuzzy matching algorithms
Map issue relationships including blocking, dependencies, and related issues
Validate issue quality with scoring system for title, description, labels, and completeness
Generate triage reports showing issue distribution and quality metrics
Apply bulk labels and find stale issues inactive for specified days
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) installed and authenticated for full functionality
Cannot create or modify issues without appropriate repository permissions
Duplicate detection uses basic keyword matching, not AI-powered semantic analysis
Does not integrate with project management tools outside GitHub ecosystem

use_cases.title: Process incoming issues daily
use_cases.description: Quickly triage new bug reports and feature requests to keep backlog organized and identify duplicates early.

use_cases.title: Track issue dependencies
use_cases.description: Map how issues relate to each other to understand what can be worked on and what is blocked.

use_cases.title: Generate triage summaries
use_cases.description: Create reports on issue quality and distribution to prioritize work and identify bottlenecks.

prompt_templates.title: Quick triage single issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Triage issue #42. Classify the type and priority, check for duplicates, assess quality, and recommend labels.

prompt_templates.title: Find duplicate issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all potential duplicate issues in this repository. Group similar issues together and recommend which to close.

prompt_templates.title: Map issue relationships
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the dependency graph for issue #42. What does it block and what blocks it?

prompt_templates.title: Batch triage unlabeled
prompt_templates.prompt: Triage all unlabeled issues. Apply appropriate type and priority labels to each one.

output: Recommended actions: Add labels bug,priority:high,scope:backend; request server logs; link to #38

best_practices: Triage new issues within 24 hours to maintain contributor engagement and prevent backlog buildup
Always verify duplicates by reading both issues before closing one as duplicate
Document your reasoning when closing or labeling issues so teams understand decisions
anti_patterns: Closing issues without checking for duplicates wastes contributor time and creates fragmented discussions
Applying too many labels makes filters unusable and creates confusion about issue status
Ignoring stale issues clutters the backlog and makes it harder to find active work

faq.question: Does this skill work with private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, as long as you are authenticated with gh auth and have permission to view and edit issues.

faq.question: How accurate is the duplicate detection?
faq.answer: Uses keyword matching with TF-IDF scoring. It finds obvious duplicates reliably but may miss semantically similar issues.

faq.question: Can I use this without GitHub CLI installed?
faq.answer: The skill requires GitHub CLI for issue operations. Install gh from cli.github.com or your package manager.

faq.question: Does this skill store or share my issue data?
faq.answer: No. All processing happens locally through GitHub API. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why is my issue showing poor quality score?
faq.answer: Quality checks title length, description completeness, labels, reproduction steps for bugs, and environment details.

faq.question: How does this differ from GitHub issue templates?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes and organizes existing issues. Templates help create better new issues. They work well together.
